page.title: 06Operation Acorn, Aldridge
page.content: Leigh's Wood adjoins Leighswood J.M.I. School and although it is an established wood, recorded in Norman times, it was untidy and rather bare. The West Midlands County Council and the British Trust for Conservation Volunteers combined forces in "Operation Acorn" in March 1985 to improve the quality and variety of growth in Leigh's Wood. The schools were involved in planting a variety of trees. With a volunteer helper each child planted one or more new trees. More than 500 trees were planted. This forms part of the "Nature Conservation Strategy" for the West Midlands. The trees make "stepping stones" in the flight path of many birds, and other travelling wildlife of the urban area. Variety in trees encouraging a variety of wildlife. A legacy for the future.
